info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 11:55AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Blizzard conditions will continue to spread into northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska this afternoon as winds increase. Gusts over 50 mph will become common by mid afternoon resulting in considerable blowing and drifting. Snow amounts will generally be 4 to 8 inches, however over a foot of snow is likely in a heavy band that has developed in Gove, Logan and Wallace counties in northwest Kansas. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow amounts will be along the Interstate 70 corridor in northwest Kansas. Lowest amounts will be in northeast Colorado.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
